cheatsheet.title: Reverse Engineering from existing system - Perform model discovery

description.b: Quick process to obtain, from the input legacy system and composing artifacts, the initial set of models required for the remainder of the process. Realized thanks to the ARTIST MDT (Model Discovery Toolbox) and its various components supporting both the Java/JEE and C#/.NET environments.

item.title: Study and identify relevant artifacts from your existing system
item.description:
Study of the existing system to be reverse engineered (and then later migrated) in order to identify the kinds of software artifacts to be considered as inputs of the process, and also the corresponding discovery support that is going to be needed.
For help and support to this manual activity, the taxonomy of artifacts proposed in ARTIST can be consulted at:

item.title: Inject content from existing software artifacts as initial models

description.b: Perform the actual injection of the useful content from the previously identified software artifacts in order to produce the initial models. This is performed, depending of the considered environment, by using one or several model discoverers. To be performed several times using different discovery components depending on the types of software artifacts to be treated.

subitem.label: For help and support to this activity, click on the button on the right to view the documentation of the current version of the ARTIST MDT

Select a model discoverer among the ones supporting Java/JEE within the ARTIST MDT in order to run it from the previously identified software artifacts: Right-click on the corresponding project or file in your Eclipse workspace, go to "Discovery - > Discoverers -> ARTIST XXX" and then set parameters if required. Alternatively, click the button on the right to perform the task.

Select a model discoverer among the ones supporting C#/.NET within the ARTIST MDT in order to run it from the previously identified software artifacts by going to the Sparx Enterprise Architecture platform for running such components.

item.title: Map discovered models to other metamodels to finalize initial models

description.b: If required, perform the mapping of the previously discovered models to other metamodels (notably to UML) when needed for further Model Understanding. This is performed, depending of the considered environment, by using one or several model transformations. Alternatively, skip the sub-steps that follow.

Right-click on the corresponding project or file in your Eclipse workspace, go to "Discovery - > Discoverers -> ARTIST XXX" and then set parameters if required. Alternatively, click the button on the right to perform the task.
